page.title: 13HOLY TRINTY CHURCH,GWERSYLLT
page.content: This is the parish church. Gwersyllt,Summerhill,Bradley and Rhosrobin are in this parish. Before 1850{Gwersyllt}was in the parish of Gresford.People walked three miles to Gresford Church. The population of Gwersyllt grew as a result of coal mining in the middle of the 1800's.The new parish church was built with money raised from local people. {Mr.Thomas Penson}designed the building,which was begun in 1849 and completed in 1851.Local limestone was used in the construction. The bells of the church were given as a memorial for those men of the parish who died in the First World War.Their names appear on a memorial plaque below the tower.the names of those killed in the Second World War were added later.
